title: Thawing Meat Safely

items.name: Cold water method (recommended quick method)
items.details: Submerge meat in a sealed plastic bag in cold water. Change the water every 30 minutes to keep it cold.

items.name: Warm/hot water method (NOT recommended)
items.details: Do not use warm or hot water. The outer layer enters the danger zone (40F-140F) where bacteria multiply rapidly.

items.name: Refrigerator thawing
items.details: The safest overall method. Place meat in the fridge and allow it to thaw slowly over 24 hours or more depending on size.

notes: The USDA advises against using warm or hot water for thawing meat. Always ensure the bag is sealed to prevent water contamination when using the cold water method.
